Get primary key column names(s)

Source: R/rdb.gen.R
pk.Rd

Returns the primary key column names(s) of the specified table, based on PostgreSQL metadata obtained at package-build time. This function is faster than pg_pk() since it doesn't perform network requests. But it can return outdated information if changes were made to the RDB PostgreSQL schema after the package was last built.

Usage

pk(tbl_name = tbl_metadata$name)

Arguments

tbl_name

Table name. A character scalar.

Value

A character scalar.
